Reviews.Content: Great Location, View       View from Room #2
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelers

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location We stayed 3 nights at this charming BB that has the best location in Florence...within short walking distance to all the major sights. The owners are very accommodating  assisted with booking museum reservations. The rooms are very clean  a nice breakfast is served in your room and the time of your choice ! Overall, a great place to stay.
Reviews.Author: LNEWHITEROCK

Reviews.Content: Great Location       Room
Reviews.Author: soonergirl_123

Reviews.Content: Not Worth It Despite the Great Savings We were in Florence over the holidays and booked late. We were looking at nearly 500 Euros a night before we found Soggiorno Battistero. The most important criteria to us at the time was cleanliness. But, now that we've stayed there, we learned about a lot of other things that contribute to a comfortable stay. I can understand why so many people rate this hotel so highly, but it's really not worth the savings.POSITIVES* Location* Kelly tries hard* It's cheap* We didn't see any pestsIf that doesn't sound like enough, it's because it's not.OTHER CRITERIA (NEGATIVES)Furnishings were sparce...that's to be expected and accepted. We didn't mind. Just be ready.Breakfast was poor -- even for Italy. At first I was impressed by the oven fresh muffins. After three days of my wife telling me that they were from the microwave, on the fourth day Kelly's husband didn't take the time to nuke it for 10 seconds and it was cold like a rock. Nope, they weren't fresh after all. But the other interesting thing is that although the rooms were non-smoking, the breakfast trays reeked of cigarettes...every day.The bathrooms were barely clean. The Ikea shower curtain showed its age and was moldy. A towel on the floor was hung back up. The clean towel rack was lined with dust from the Renaissance.We had a back room that was far from quiet as some reviews suggest. Because it's in the heart of a tourist zone, we heard restaurateurs throwing out their trash for what seemed like all night. Then the bums came in and the sound of glass bottles and the sorting of trash added to the din.Sheets were clean. Blankets...?The most troubling part of the experience is the management's insistence on coming into our room EVERY day (despite our requests not to) and even rearranging our things. I stay at over a hundred hotels per year (I'm a consultant) -- I've never seen anything like this.Managing a hotel in a place like Florence is EXTREMELY difficult work. This place tries, but not nearly enough. In the end, the savings weren't worth it. This place would be PERFECT for a backpacker under 25. But, it was a mistake for anyone who can afford a comfortable stay.
Reviews.Author: Kartvelebi

Reviews.Content: Definitely would come back Here are my impressionsPlus Location, location, location! Good value for the Price, rooms are clean and quiet.Kelly is very friendly and helpful.Not so great (but wouldn't stop me from booking here again).No TV in the room, on the 3rd floor no elevator. Beds and pillows are hard but that seems to be normal in Italy all of the 3 places we stayed were like that.
Reviews.Author: zecke

Reviews.Content: Comfortable, Friendly, Convenient and Good Price Stayed for 3 nights in early June 2007. This is the second time we have been to Florence so we were familiar with the area. Selected the hotel based on its listing in Rick Steve's book. The owner, Kelly, was very helpful in recommending restaurants and in arranging to make reservations for restaurants and musuems (I would recommend that you make reservations for the museums during the peak tourist season- its worth the extra couple of euros.) Location of the BB was perfect. Right next to the Duomo. Did not have a room with a view but that can be a blessing in disguise if you want a quiet night's rest. Lots of steps to climb to get to the BB. Going up and down the stairs a few times a day helps to burn some of the calories gained from the wonderful food that one consumes, but if you have a problem climbing stairs or have heavy luggage, it can be an issue. The breakfast was punctually served and filling (not your typical Italian breakfast. More of a continental style breakfast-Coffee, juice, warm muffins, jam, packaged toast and cheese )Room was clean, spacious and airy. If it gets too hot, switch on the overhead fan (they also have airconditioning-but did not need to use it.) The bathroom was clean, but was a bit tiny. Almost ran out of toilet paper, had to ask for another roll. and for soap. We had a very comfortable and pleasant stay here. This is definately a place I would recommend to others and one that I would like to stay at again on our next trip to Florence.
Reviews.Author: WandererRhodeIsland

Reviews.Content: Perfect location, amazing views, comfortable B       Our room
Reviews.Author: Lab804

Reviews.Content: Perfect Location I was visiting my daughter in college there for the semester, and happened to find this place.. Perfect location across from the Duomo with a clear view of the courtyard. And the nicest people running it (Calif and Italy natives), who even helped my daughter find an accommodation where her apt lease was up. The kicker..........best rate by far as long as you do not mind climbing a few flights of stairs, which I used as a valid excuse to justify more gelato tasting. There are only a few rooms here but if you can get one, take it. This place is not for whiners who want the ritz quality at low prices. These are clean small Europe type rooms well cared for, and the ambiance is all around you in the city, not in your hallway.
Reviews.Author: dakotadad

Reviews.Content: Delightful (French Teacher, Art Historian and Professional Singer) Soggiorno Battistero was really what I was looking for: clean, convenient, close to the train station AND it included a daily exercise program FOR FREE (the stairs). I didn't mind the stairs at all. In fact, after a day of pizza and gelato I was glad to be given the opportunity to work a small part of it off. Kelly and Luca are friendly and knowledgeable. Luca was very helpful with a local gelato place which wasn't right by the Duomo. Gelatos are super expensive in Florence but he recommended a place that has over 30 HOMEMADE flavors and only 2 euros for a cone with 3 flavors. I loved their small reception area where I would write in my journal at night and browse the restaurant business cards. I found LEONARDO (a self-service restaurant) to be exactly what I was looking for: no cover charge, no tips, I picked my own food, excellent choices, and no waiting for the bill! All in all I completely recommend SOGGIORNO BATTISTERO and please disregard other negative or non-stellar reviews. We all know that Americans (or other nationalities) don't go to Italy to find America or American conveniences. I celebrate the differences and count it a gain as an experience. Bravo Luca and Kelly.
Reviews.Author: ClaudeCassagne

Reviews.Content: No masterpiece Yes, the location is great, but what location in Florence isn't great? Exhausted after a long plane ride, train trip and walk in the rain, we were dissappointed in the cold reception we got from the owner. He seemed put out that he had to answer the door and show us to our room. A room with a view was not available, but we knew that in advance. Our room was relatively clean, but lacking any charm...I'd say it was bare bones shabby. It was also noisey, overlooking an alley where someone was evidentely repairing automobiles. We would not stay here again.
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryTeacher

Reviews.Content: Room with a View       careful of the stairs, not for faint of heart
Reviews.Author: SueandRobyn

Reviews.Content: Great location My husband and I stayed at the Soggiorno Battistero in early May for three nights. All of the other posters are correct: hotel is three floors up, the rooms and bathrooms are small, the breakfast isn't the greatest. We still found this place to be fabulous. Our room had a great view of the Duomo and Baptistery, Kelly was friendly and informative about train/bus schedules and dinner reservations, and the double paned windows made the place very quiet at night. We would recommend this spot to any traveler looking to stay in the heart of Florence for a great price.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great view, and great location       Large doors...small sign
Reviews.Author: dvaughn971

Reviews.Content: Great view for a budget hotel We just stayed at the Soggiorno Battistero. We found the hotel to be clean and well kept (as well as freshly painted). The owners were friendly and accomidating. It was nice to have your own keys to come and go as you please -- almost like having your own apartment next to the Baptistry. The hotel is located on the 4th floor with no elevator -- so it is a climb but it is Italy and to be expected. The shower is small (again it is Italy and this is to be expected) and if you do not put the shower curtain in correctly you can flood the bathroom. The other thing not mentioned previously is that the tile floor in the winter can be a bit chilly -- bring warm socks to walk around in. We found that the heat was self controlled and there is an extra shutter box around the window to keep the room warm/noise out (perhaps this is a new feature). This is a hotel to consider. For the price -- you can't beat the view.
Reviews.Author: eng_girl

Reviews.Content: Great Views in Florence My fiance and I stayed at Soggiorno Battistero for five nights in January of 2005. The view from our room was unbelievable - you could almost reach out and touch Florence's famous baptistry. Both Kelly and Luca, our hosts, were helpful during our stay but it was after our train to Venice was cancelled in an unplanned strike that they went above and beyond, with Kelly calling various car rental places and our hotel in Venice for us before finally settling us back into our room for an extra unplanned night. Rooms may be basic but are comfortable, pillows may be a bit hard. Breakfast, served in the room, was a nice change from cereal and pastry everywhere else. The piazza was quiet outside except on Friday but perhaps it would be louder in the summer. All in all, a good value for the price and a place worth experiencing.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good place to stay on a low budget The biggest problem is the overwhelming noise from the piazza below. It's pretty loud well into the night and when the crowd clears the clean-up crews start so the noise is ongoing. Bring your earplugs. Otherwise, the accommodations were good for the price. You will not be pampered here but if you are just looking for a clean, safe place to stay this will do just fine.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A View thats great, but thats all. A room with a view, as stated in the web page, and it truly is wonderful. But when the owners can offer this why would they have to offer any thing else? A shower that leaks water on the floor then no clean towels when used to mop up the water. A dissmal breakfast. No tea or coffee facilities available at all. A sitting area in the main room roped off, lest you feel inclined to sit there. No service available at all just leave a note on the desk. ( Other guests even knocked on our door asking could they borrow breakfast plates  cups when we had finished with ours)And by far the worst, after booking I was assured we would recieve assistance to get our luggage up 4 steep flights of stairs, but is it forth coming? No. A complaining owner, about having to do this, and on leaving well one look at the waiting bags sends him scurring behind a closed door. We spent a month travelling and this was our worst experience in service and generally feeling unwelcome and like intruders Our overall thought was, they got our money, we got a view. Would we stay there again? Probably not.
Reviews.Author: azlell

Reviews.Content: Soggiorno Battistero is the GREATEST! My wife and I stayed in Soggiorno Battistero for 4 nights in November 2003.  I am writing this review, now on July 19, 2004 because I cannot forget this place. It was that great! The location is the greatest thing about this place. Although we did not meet Kelly, Luca was a great host. Always helpful, always courteous.  The people who complain about the towels being wet are obviously some typical self-absorbed whiners that are part of the reason Americans have the bad reputation that the rest of us have to try to prove wrong. Hang the towels up yourselves, morons. The breakfast, yes it was simple. It was always delivered on time to your door and what do you expect for the price you pay? Some people expect to be treated like they are staying at the Ritz while paying Travelodge rates!  The rooms were kept very clean, simply furnished, absolutely gorgeous view from the rooms, excellent people watching, and the location is the best in Florence. I would recommend this place to anyone. I will stay here when I return to Florence, no questions. It is true that there are a good deal of stairs to climb when you stay here. Hello!?! This is Italy. This building is 600 years old. Elevators are a relatively new addition to architecture and lazy bums that can't walk up 4 flights of stairs or wish they had a TV in their room should stay home in their double wide trailers.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location, solid value My wife and I were here in November of 2003. The location is unbeatable, just a few paces from the Duomo. An added bonus was that our well appointed room looked out over the Baptistery and the Duomo...gorgeous...and for only 80 Euro per night.Contrary to what some have stated, we found the service to be friendly and attentive. The breakfast comprised two pieces of toast, a hard boiled egg, a muffin and OJ, which was the best hotel breakfast we had on our two week trip. The only downside is that the hotel is on the fourth floor, which is actually also a positive because of the resulting view.Bottom line, I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.
Reviews.Author: Johnathon

Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location or views. My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in June '04. The hotel was effeciently run and clean. The views from room 2 were spectatcular. We were concerned about street noise, but the windows eliminated all evening sound. You are in the heart of Florence and it can be very noisey, even past midnight. No TV. Who cares. You didn't come to Florence to watch TV. No internet. Yes, we expected to have access, but found internet cafes. Kelly and Luca were cordial and helpful in every way. The breakfast was a fine start to a new day. When we left early on the last day, they prepared a take away breakfast for us the night before. Received 10% discount for cash and lack of air-cond. Definitely would return.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: some positives, some negatives First of all, the positives: great location, great views, very clean rooms. Now, the disappointments: the hosts, Kelly  Luca were both less than friendly (evidently we weren't the only ones who felt this way from reading previous reviews); on the morning following our first night here, we showered and threw our towels on the floor to be replaced. When we returned to the room, we noticed the towels had been picked up and hung up still damp. When we asked for fresh towels we were told that towel exchange was every other day. This was not disclosed before, and who just picks up your dirty towels off the floor and hangs them back up? We thought this was weird. Then, the heat is on lock-out, which means they control when it comes on; several times it got quite chilly in our room before the heat came back on. We asked if the heat could be turned on and were told that it was pre-set. There were numerous signs about how washing laundry in the sink was PROHIBITED. We found this interesting since this is a Rick Steves recommended hotel, and what does Rick Steves recommend? Traveling light and washing out laundry in your hotel sink. Also, the included breakfast was cheesy. It included 2 forms of prepackaged bread. Here we are in a city full of great bakeries, some fresh biscotti or muffins would have been nice. And finally, the walls are paper-thin. We could here the hostess putting her cup down on the counter and turning pages in a book from inside our room. We are budget travels, not hotel snobs, and given the choice, we would not stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location, no Internet access My husband and I stayed here in Sept. '03 for our honeymoon. All reviews are true. This place did have a great location. No TV. The breakfast was OK. The climb with luggage was difficult - don't stay here if you have issues with stairs. (For us, it was fine.) We had read somewhere (I think Rick Steves?) that Internet access was provided to guests, but when we got there, there was no shared computer for guests to use. There was a computer that looked broken though - perhaps it had just broken down? Anyway, we needed access as we were looking up train schedules - ended up searching for and finally going to an Internet cafe.
Reviews.Author: wandrerr

Reviews.Content: A little bit of home in Italy My best friend and I stayed at Soggiorno Battistero in June 2003, and can't wait to go back. The owners, Kelly and Lucca are amazing, they were fun and informative, and really down to earth. Staying at Soggiorno Battistero is like staying with old friends. While there may not be a t.v. or an elevator, who cares your in Florence, you should be out enjoying the sites and taking in the culture and splendor of Florence. The rooms are simple but very comfortable with all the necessities, and the most supurb views in all of florence. The hotel is in the heart of florence, literally steps from many of Firenze's attractions, and near many fabulous stores (Gucci and many other high end), and restaurants. To really experience the charm of florence Soggiorno Battistero is a must!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location, but No TV The location is great because it faces the duomo, but there is no TV in the room. So, if you don't mind facing 4 walls at night, then it's okay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Florence and Soggiorno Battistero My wife and I spent three nights in Florence in mid-September and stayed at the Soggiorno Battistero. The location is absolutely perfect. You look straight out your window and see the Baptistry right across from you. You look to the right and see the front steps of the Duomo. All this for 93 euros per night. Pretty amazing.The owner is an American, Kelly, so contact with her is very pleasant. She gave us some restaurants to try, as well as making our reservations to the Academia and Uffizi.The rooms are standard Italy, small but big enough that we weren't falling over each other. There is no TV in case you want to keep up with news. The breakfast is nothing special. I walked around Florence early to find a pastry shop to take goodies back to the room. For $2, I had of couple of great pastries and had tea or coffee from the tray that is brought to the room.The walk up three flights of stair is a little tough when loaded with luggage, but the result is worth the effort.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great location The owners are American and Italian, Kelly the american can be grumpy but The Italian is a gentleman. The Hotel is on the third 'piano' and the staircase is very reminiscent of 'The Talented Mr Ripley'....fantastic! The rooms all have the most fabulous view of the Duomo and Baptistry and are so close you feel you could touch them. The rooms are clean but room 2 is very small and the bathroom too tiny really but who needs luxury at 90euros a night? The other rooms are all better and as there are only 5 in total you have a good chance of not getting number two. The breakfast is adequate and prepackaged. The best thing about this place is the location. We have stayed there twice now and recommended it to friends who have also stayed there. All of them loved it...what more can I say?, Kathryn Else
Reviews.Author: Elsie_Skegby

Reviews.Content: Great location -- Marginal breakfast I stayed at the Soggiorno Battistero in January 2003. What an incredible location! You walk out the front door and the Duomo is 50 yards to your right, and the baptistry is 20 yards straight ahead. You simply cannot sleep closer to the center of Florence -- Well, unless you curled up on the steps of the Duomo. The Soggiorno Battistero is located on the 4th floor of the building, so be prepared to climb some steps as there is no elivator. Additionally, the closest parking is about 6-8 blocks away, so you'll need to haul your luggage a ways. However, this isn't much of a problem as you'll be walking around downtown anyway. The room was bright and clean, with a very high vaulted celling. Some of the rooms open directly to the square. There were a few dissapointments. 1. the owner, Kelly, seems a bit grumpy at times. OK, fine, who isn't? 2. the breakfast was very meager -- a couple slices of dry toast and some juice. You'd do better stopping by the local market and buying a roll and a cup of coffee. Regarding prices, we paid 85 Euros a night. There is a 5 Euro discount for paying in cash.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Muy bien ubicado (en la plaza...   showReview(13611041, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Estuvimos tres dias y la...   showReview(11338489, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Struttura dell'ottocento al 3...   showReview(11338490, 'full');
